name: Logical and Physical Access Controls
description: The entity implements logical and physical access controls to protect information assets from unauthorized access, including network security, encryption, authentication mechanisms, and infrastructure security configurations.
objective: Ensure that logical and physical access controls are designed and operating effectively to restrict access to information assets to authorized users, processes, and devices at authorized times and locations.
control_activities: Network segmentation separates production and non-production environments
Firewalls and security groups restrict network traffic to necessary ports and protocols
Data encryption is implemented for data at rest and in transit
Multi-factor authentication is required for administrative access
Infrastructure deployed in multiple availability zones for resilience
Security monitoring and logging captures access attempts and changes
Physical access to data centers is restricted and monitored
evidence_requirements: Access logs and security event logs
testing_procedures: Review network architecture for proper segmentation
Examine firewall rules for least privilege configuration
Verify encryption is enabled for data at rest and in transit
Test MFA enforcement for administrative access
Confirm infrastructure is deployed across multiple availability zones
Review security monitoring and alerting configurations
Examine security logs for completeness and retention
